snippet: Eileen Lagala’s son said the last he saw of his phone, the police were putting it in a plastic bag. “I asked him for the password,” she said. “That was a mistake.”
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on Eileen Lagala, Staten Island mother who plead guilty to trespassing, misdemeanor that carries no jail time in case connected to her son Anthony Lagala Jr's drug-and-gun trafficking ring; authorities believe Eileen Lagala remotely erased contents of her son's iPhone, which was being held as evidence, but she claims she only wanted to shut phone off.
lead_paragraph: Eileen Lagala’s son said the last he saw of his phone, the police were putting it in a plastic bag. “I asked him for the password,” she said. “That was a mistake.”

headline.main: Erased iPhone Gets a Mother in Trouble
headline.print_headline: Erased iPhone Gets a Mother in Trouble
